metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19060 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
A memory leak in the adis_update_scan_mode() function indrivers/iio/imu/adis_buffer.c in the Linux kernel before 5.3.9 allowsattackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption), akaCID-ab612b1daf41.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19060` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-179.209
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-179.209
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-179.209
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-72.81~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-72.81~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-72.81~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1071.78
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1107.118
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1056.58~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1064.69
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1050.53
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1030.33~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1133-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1133.142
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1137-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1137.145
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-179.209').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-72.81~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1071.78').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1107.118').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1056.58~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1064.69').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1050.53').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.33~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1133.142').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1137.145').
